Chopped salad was delish but steak and lamb were both tough. Bruschetta was ok. Wouldn't order any of items again, other than the salad. Very noisy..hard to hear conversation at our table. Hostess and server were nice. Unlikely we'd return for dinner but might try lunch sometime.

Went for half-priced brunch this weekend and it was awesome! Totally plan to return and pay full price - they're already beyond reasonable! And, there's a delicious assortment of interesting and delicious breakfast cocktails - what more could a brunch-goer want!?!

The service is absolutely excellent here (as well as food of course.)  thanks Mark and Rich and Nancy for always remembering what I like to drink and offering desserts you think I'd love. I miss the Spumoni, though. Bring it back!!!

Of course you are at the airport so keep that in mind.  The food is not good - I had their special Reuben sandwich - it was dry the meat wasn't tender and very small portion for $16. Over priced even for the airport - save your money and eat at McDonald.

Apparently this restaurant has received awesome reviews (for an airport restaurant), and they make that known on the menu cover. I was really excited to try the chopped salad with avocado and steak, per one of the reviewers on yelp, but the waitress said that wasn't an option. Fail. Since I was craving steak, I ordered the testosterone salad and the bruschetta duet. The salad was really rich, and I have mixed feelings on the drunken cherries. The steak was really nicely cooked, and the potato chips were a good crunch. If you love bleu cheese, definitely get this salad!

The bruschetta, however, was meh. It comes with 4 pieces generously topped with sauteed mushrooms and chopped tomatoes (separately). The bread was far too buttered, and the toppings were just okay. I could do better at home myself.

It is VERY loud sitting in the dining area because there's the gate intercom speakers right above, so don't even think about talking on the phone. The staff were nice, but everybody looked like they hadn't slept in days and had ultimate resting bitch face.

We had a mushroom pan fry and grilled salmon on arugula salad. It was very good even though the portion was small but what can you expect with the high rents for restaurant establishments at the airport? The service by TJ was  very friendly, he tries to make it fun for the travelers who may be tired or frustrated, which was very nice.

Meh--the menu has more alcohol choices than food. I ordered the open faced steak sandwich and it was less than thrilling, for $18. Service was ok, food came out quickly. I would have had a Quarter Pounder from McDonalds next door!

You will not be disappointed.  

This place has fantastic food, cocktails and service!  

I got the mini mushroom fry, my husband got the chicken fried trout, both were outstanding.

I like trying new things, but I will certainly eat here again the next time I'm in town.

Ate this so fast that I forgot to take a picture. I'd recommend the Stetson chopped salad and the Common salmon- both delicious and healthy. Staff seated us quickly and brought food out promptly which really wasn't necessary because we showed up at the airport 3.5 hours early for a 1 hour flight home. You know just to be on the "safe side".

Cowboy Ciao is the one-of-a-kind place that makes discovering restaurants will traveling become super fun.

Hard to describe the cuisine when you can get anything from a Korean-inspired-short rib to wild mushroom ragout over polenta.  Or a chopped salad that includes arugula, dried corn and trail mix in a ranch dressing.  I know, this all sounds incredibly weird but it works.  Wild west regional meets international fusion?  I don't know what to label the food, but the food rocks.

The scene is buzzy and hip.  Lots of done-up Scottsdale types.  But still plenty of jeans being worn there...jeans done just so, but still jeans.  Really fun decor that helps diners be happy.

Totally fun and satisfying!

As always, sat at the bar and had their chopped salad and a martini- usually gin but this time made with Square One Cucumber vodka, Hendrick's gin, and a splash of lillet. Excellent end to a good week.

I lived in the Phoenix area for 16 years but left three years ago.  One of my favourite restaurants was Cowboy Ciao and my favourite dish there was the Short Ribs.  However, I noticed that they have changed the recipe for the Short Ribs and it now some pastrami concoction.  I do hope it is good as the last incarnation of Short Ribs they had as it was, hands down, the very best ribs I have ever had.  And that's saying a lot because they ribs are beef ribs and it is not as easy to make beef ribs as tasty as pork ribs, such as Baby Back Ribs.

Great brunch.  Spicy Bloody Mary's.  When I want to have something spicy and just a little different I head to Cowboy Ciao's for brunch.  One complaint is that you have to pay extra for the slipper bread.  It is so delicious, it'd be a nice touch if they put it on the table.  The Stetson Chopped Salad is a famous dish, as is the mushroom and polenta.  It is a little "Scottsdale" but the food makes up for it.  Now that the bridge is open, it would be nice to head out there and then a quick stroll on the bridge.  Oh, the mac and cheese is also delicious!  The drinks are good (especially since it is also owned by Kasimeriz) but the desserts are bit weak.

if you're into heavy, rich food, Cowboy Ciao is your place.  i wasn't thoroughly impressed with the food, but the service is good.  very welcoming hostess, if i do say so myself.

honestly, i'd rather walk around the corner to fnb - it's way better.

First the hostess ignored me because she thought my parents were more important than I was even though the reservation was under my name. She eventually figured out that we were all in the same party after ignoring my check in when my mother politely told her we were all together. She also was unaccommodating when asked if there was a trash can near by. My mother ended up having to visit the restroom trash can before we were seated. 
When we ordered salads and asked for one more fork (a fork fell under the table) our server rolled his eyes at us (Lou). 
I asked for the simple mixed green salad (first on the menu) and was met with a rude attitude from the server about dressing. He seemed annoyed when he asked what dressing I would like for it and I responded with the pesto buttermilk (which was the standard dressing according to the menu). 
The entrees we ordered did not say on the menu if had any spicy ingredients but five of the six orders were too hot too eat. 
The Syrah blend we drank was just gross. Do not order it unless you'd like a flavor of immature wine mixed with kool aid. 
When the servers came to clear plates, we asked for boxes to take leftovers and were met with our server's now-signature eye roll. 
We tried to be appreciative and polite throughout the whole meal but everyone was uncomfortable because of the way menus were thrown at us and the obvious inconvenience we caused to the servers from asking for the food items and when we wanted the boxes for leftovers after. 
When one person was sipping their wine, he was informed that no more would be poured to him "if he kept swirling his glass" even though he'd had about one half of a glass of wine. While he was not looking for more to drink and an unsolicited threat, this is a good example of the condescending attitude that seemed to permeate every interaction with the staff. 
Ultimately the win was the alberino (white wine) and the brussel sprouts from the duck appetizer even though every piece of duck was more than fat than duck. 
I would suggest eating somewhere else.
This restaurant was a disappointment and I won't be back.

The three star is only for the salad. It was delicious, but over priced. 

I was here several years ago and I remembered it to be very good. I made a mental note to come back, but this time around it very disappointing. Horrible service. It wasn't even a weekend. First they forgot my appetizer, then it took about an hour for them to bring our main dishes out. We ended up canceling our order because we had to leave for a meeting and was just really bothered by the service. They had one waitress and we couldn't ask about our dish  until she made her rounds to all the table. 

Come here for the food, but don't expect great service all the time.

WOW!  What a fantastic little place!  It is a bit Cowboy Hipster but if you've been to Austin Texas, then you can appreciate this spot.  Service, food, ambiance are all spot on!  They make a heck-uv-a great drink too!  Cool your spurs and stay a while!

not for picky eaters! im one, ill admit.

everybody seems to love this place but i cant figure out why. we went with another couple who raved about it. i wasnt impressed with the menu -- it was certainly interesting and different, but nothing amazing.

it was okay, but i probably wont go back unless a group is going and i dont have a choice. i dont what all the fuss is about.

Round 2 - Restaurant Week again!

This time around I was quite disappointed.  My group ordered pretty much everything on the Restaurant Week menu.  I went with the Seared Ahi Tuna, Short Ribs, and Peanut Butter Bar.  Overall, everything was well cooked, however over....over salty!  The texture was just fine, but in the end too much salt.  I usually drink a lot of water when I eat, but tonight they should have left the pitcher.  My group in general drank a lot of water!  I would talk more about the food, in the end all I can remember was --- dang that was salty!  Sorry gang I don't know if I can go another round for this place. Ding, ding, ding -- Enjoy!

Wow, not bad for airport food! We had a connection at Sky Harbor, and it was 1 Eastern so I grabbed something to eat across from our gate. The line was fairly short, but it took forever. I don't know if that's because an order was complex or it was just slow, but it was bad.

I got a west coast wrap with chips, and it was pretty pricey. The wrap was excellent though. It tasted very fresh and had plenty of stuff inside it. The chips were exceptional--probably some of the best chips I have ever had.

What can I say? Good airport food! All right! Thumbs up!

Three stars for the food, it was actually really great and I would have loved to try a few other items if I was more hungry. Two stars off for it to take over 30 minutes to get a salad at an airport where everyone is in a hurry and for the atrocious service. My server was downright rude and couldn't have been less interested in serving my table.
One of the best meals I've had...high west rye and delicious food.  Every dish was awesome.

Amazing salads! I had the Stetson Cobb salad... I picked avocado as my protein but the salmon looked awesome too

Has take out as well as seating and an extensive bar

The only bummer is my salad cost $14 and change, which seems a lot for the amount u get. But it is an airport location after all.

As foodies, we were overcome with the menu!  The place is not that cool, but the menu is wonderful with abundant choices of food that was both creative and very, very, well done.  Service was enthusiastic and well done.  If you want to suffer because you can't pick from wonderful choices, perfectly prepared, then this is the place to go.
Stetson Chop Salad has become a staple since moving into the area. Service has always been responsive as well.

Place had a nice dark atmosphere with candlelight. I ordered a short rib over potatoes and brussel sprouts. For the almost $40 dish, I thought it was a little underwhelming. I expected the meat to be awesome but it was ok. There was some fatty parts and some flavor which made it delicious, but other parts were just plain. I found myself scraping the plate for the sauce cuz there was just no taste in the meat. The potatoes were delicious and so were the brussel sprouts. Kinda weird when the sides taste better than the main meat piece. I've eaten less expensive plates with more flavor. The food looked nice but didn't match the visual hype.

The garlic bread was amazing though.

The food was excellent, the chopped salad, which really isn't a salad, is a delicious starter and easily serves two. I also had the burger which was amazing. Don't ruin it with ketchup or mustard allow the special sauce they use to enhance your meal. You do need to ask for lettuce, tomato, and onions on the side however. That is if you don't want just bread and meet. My only criticism is that it is very loud, and a little on the pricey side for what you get.

This is good. They had four stars until my food came way late. Boo 
Other then that Very impressed with the food.  Slightly expensive but you know its the airport. 
I love the new wave of bringing in local flavors into the local airports.

Cowboy Ciao is hard to rate. So ego driven. Some great courses. (Try the mushrooms). Don't go there if you care about wine. The wine list is incomprehensible. 40 pages listed by price. Everything lumped together only sorted by price. Really? They don't even sort by format. God help you if you want a half bottle. They are mixed in with the full bottles. You have to go line by line for 40 pages looking for the half bottles. Finally I asked if their half bottles are stored together. The answer was yes. I then asked if I could just go and look at them to save time. Answer? No, they don't allow anyone to see their cellar. Restaurants who get it are proud to give a tour of their cellar.....

Our waiter, Ian,  was terrific - one star. The food was amazing - two stars.  The place was so noisy we could not talk to each other at a small table for two.  We told them it was our anniversary when we made the reservation, but that meant nothing to them, so we left before dessert and coffee.  It is a shame, as the food was outstanding, but the ambience was terrible.

Our first time here!  Been wanting to come here for years!!  Celebrating my birthday today.   Cool looking place and a pretty big bar also.  We came for AZ Restaurant week.  After all the hubbub about their chopped salad, i do have to say that it was very good and unique that has some sort of crunch to it that made it very interesting.  We both had the shrimp and avocado appetizer.   That was really a "meh" starter...no real umph to the shrimp in terms of flavor and the avocado just added a creamy texture to the dish but no real zing.  Then the main course consisted of a beef filet with a bleu cheese butter topper...fantastic!  It had asparagus and yukon mashed taters.  The potatoes were grand!  I had the pork mole ravioli which had an outstanding flavor and nice spicy kick that threw me off initially but really appreciate how it complimented the dish.  And then there is the pastrami style short ribs...OMG!  It tasted like an old school pastrami dish that i used to get at Katz's deli in NYC...(for those who don't know, that was a compliment).  Finished off with a chocolate panna cota which also came around to the slight above the meh level again.  Oh!  Last thing, there is this superb martini that has raspberry infused vodka (its called "ciao" something...give that a try!l. We will go again to sample some other dishes and let you know about it.

I'm really leaniing more toward 3 1/2 stars. I ordered the (corn)nut crusted scallops and the bruschetta. The scallops were small (only 3 to an order this is definitely an appetizer not a meal) and the bruschetta large. I saw a lot of people ordering the salad. They said the dressing was really good. But the amount also looked rather puny. Better to order from the togo menu or try your luck somewhere else. 4 stars because it did taste good and it was clean and fast service. But the food was more like a 3 1/2.

I have been wanting to try Cowboy Ciao for a while now and finally happened to be in the area with my husband a couple weeks ago and decided to try. I am apparently in the minority here, but it was a major disappointment from a food standpoint. 

We started with bruscetta which had way too much vinegar to the point where you could barely tell you were eating tomatoes. It was doused with so much oil and vinegar that the bread underneath was soggy within a couple of minutes of sitting there. 

I had the espresso rubbed filet Mignon and asked for the "sauce" which the waitress said had allot of heat to it to be on the side so I could control the heat. Now, I appreciate some heat in my food and am no wimp but even without the sauce with the heat in it - this fillet had so much heat that I had to take a sip of water after each bite and could barely taste the fillet. It was awful. And the potatoes were slightly undercooked and not hot. 

My husband had the short ribs which he said were OK but not outstanding or even memorable. We chose to skip desert. The presentation of the food was gorgeous, the place itself was cute and our waitress did a good job. It's possible we both just ordered the wrong thing for our tastes - but I'm not inspired to want to drop another $110 based on our experience. Arrowhead Grill in Glendale blows this away for this price point.
Stetson Chopped salad. Go for no other reason but for this yummy salad. The rest of their dishes are pretty good too but hands down the salad is the best. Try it, you will not be disappointed.
The Stetson Salad was delicious and I'm not big on salads. The Mushroom Pan Fry was unique and very good as well.
Two words: Chopped salad. Mmmm. I crave it on a daily basis.
Disgusting filet mignon was blue! Not even cooked. So gross. Who's cooking back there? 2 year olds???

I hate airport restaurants. You're trapped. You don't have much choice. The staff are generally unhappy and mildly interesting. This place was sooooo different!

We started with drinks. The choice and selection is amazing. They can pretty much make any drink. 

The food - unbelievable. Started with the infamous Stetson salad. It's incredible. I've never had anything like it!

Short ribs and fillet minion were incredible. 

The best part - Terry - out waitress. She is awesome. She was so caring and diligent - unseen in most restaurants - much less an airport one!

I would consider coming to the airport just for a meal here - forget about flying!

Wow. Just went to Cowboy Ciao for the first time. So many great choices on the menu. Hard to pick. We got a few and they were all amazing. Can't wait to go back and work our way through the entire menu. Super. And the staff was great. Quick to help and very friend. It was a busy night and the staff was always there to help.

Cool! So great to discover eats in an airport that makes you feel good. Cowboy Ciao did just that! The unforntunate part is that I arrived just before 8am and was still not hungry from the night before. I just wanted to relax for a couple hours and have a coffee in a real cup, nut paper or styro. Finally I chose to mozey in. Nice little table for two. Waitress, Jennifer, greeted me and brought my coffee. She was such sweetheart! I later decided to have either and mimosa or Bloody Girl and Jennifer assisted so authentically with that, asking if I liked spicy. Yes! I only wish it were 3hr later. But I did see several breakfast dishes and they were perfect. Breakfast potatoes looked just how I prefer! Oooooo I wish I could be hungry!! Exotic Mushroom Pan Fry would be my first choice. I just hope I can go through Phoenix on my next flight! And best of luck to Jennifer!

Just are here and the food was great and very filling. I had the chicken and waffle "sandwich", which is a piece of fried chicken and half a red velvet waffle. I'm not a coleslaw kinda girl so I opted for the homemade chips on the side. I finished with the Oh Canada Peanut Butter Bat, which was delish.

Service was great! They were super helpful and came by at just the right time.

My friend and I stopped here when we were flying to Hawaii for a few drinks. We tried the Bloody Mary Jane and mimosas. Their mimosas are made with prosecco which I love and am so happy about. The Bloody Mary Jane was made with vodka and mescal which gave it a smoky flavor. I think too much fresh basil was used but I'm the least biggest fan of basil so take that as it's worth. We also ordered chips with a side of pesto dipping sauce. The sauce and chips were good. Prices are airport prices so be prepared for that. I would stop here again if I were in the phx airport for some drinks and quick snacks. Oh, a mimosa is $13... Maybe I won't be back...

I'm not one for hyperbole, but this may have been

THE  BEST      MEAL      OF   MY       LIFE!!!!

I'd like to hold an awards show and give out lifetime achievement trophies to the following individuals:

1.  To the chef, who exceeded my expectations again and again. The Stetson salad, wild boar meatballs, and Korean-style BBQ short ribs (and that killer side of au-gratin brussel sprouts) and you, sir, have won my heart and my stomach.  I want to fill a swimming pool with that BBQ sauce!

2.  To our server, Richard.  Your genuine excitement for the food was a nice change from past servers reluctant to give a real recommendation.  You were cordial and professional and made sure we enjoyed our time with you.  I don't know, I may name my unborn child after you in tribute.

3.  To the pastry chef, Country.  Your bread pudding was exceptional, but what a surprise, your ice creams were downright dreamy!  The scoop of brown butter ice cream took my tastebuds on a field trip through chilled fields of chocolate truffles.

Thank you thank you for a wonderful birthday dinner!

Is there a 4.5 star review? Service was the only question mark. I'm still trying to decide if our server was surly or just the ironically fun type of surly. 

The food is divine though. Started with the chopped salad that everyone raves about. My wife had been here before and swore by it. She didn't mention that the salad had salmon in it though. I not only hate salmon, I'm also allergic to it. However, we found out you can sub chicken and that's exactly what I did. Fantastic taste and the texture is what really caught me. It's nutty, meaty, and still a salad. Fantastic!

My entree was the pastrami seasoned beef rib. Just order it. It's like a big piece of pot roast or even like a real corned beef, but with the peppered seasoning on the outside. It falls apart like a great roast should. It's accompanied by Brussels sprouts and mashed potatoes. The Brussels sprouts and the corned beef nature of the meat make it a bit like an Irish corned beef and cabbage (but, I personally LOVE that). 

I will be back and I won't even need to look at the menu. Get the pastrami seasoned beef rib.

Nothing like the old town location. We've been eating at the old town location for years. The famous chopped salad is different with different dressing. Service was terrible. Greeted by rude host said I couldn't sit at table or booth. Strange won't return.

I don't consider myself a foodie, but if I did, I imagine this would be a regular on my rotation of local restaurants!  I actually have only eaten at Cowboy Ciao twice... once, a while back, for dinner, and then just the other day for lunch (with Sarah G).  

I have to agree with Sarah... the lunchtime service was nothing special.  Our waitress was not overly friendly and she didn't give us much attention either.  We had to ask about several menu items including a refresher on the ingredients in the "Stetson Chopped Salad" as the menu doesn't say...

Luckily, the company I was with made up for the 'eh' service.  The salad (I had the Stetson Chopped) was actually really unique and the perfect size for a light lunch.  

I remember the wine menu being pretty impressive as well as that Exotic Mushroom Special, so I'm sure I'll be back to visit Cowboy Ciao eventually.  I'm probably being generous with 4 stars, but maybe it's just because I am giving them the benefit of the doubt.  In any case, as Stephy S likes to say... 'Ciao for now!'

I'm giving this place 4 stars because of the amazing service we just got. We were in Phoenix on a quick layover and time was scarce. The unbelievably helpful cashier went out of her way to tell us what we could have that would work for vegans. 

We got the Stetson Chopped Salad minus the meat and cheese and a vinaigrette instead of whatever normally comes with it. The woman who seemed to have a limp and probably some health problems (she mentioned she can't eat broccoli or tomatoes) was running the show, going out of her way for us and even walking back to the kitchen when she caught them putting cheese in our salads. She stopped that like a sheriff in charge of her county and while we worried about her getting around, we couldn't have been more grateful. (Give that woman a raise!) 

Our food was ready quickly and the manager even came out to see if we had been taken care of. Again, awesome customer service. 

The menu is limited for vegans but we made it work and the Stetson Chopped Salad was quite good. It has freeze-dried fresh corn (new to me) and we got avocado instead of chicken.  Really really good. It already comes with cous cous which makes it quite filling.  

The food was decent but if I could make that cashier my grandmother and take care of her forever I would. Be nice to her if you see her.
Lost in a maze of airport food, this was a fantastic gem! Lots of fresh ingredients in their varied and very appetizing options.

So....I've written very few reviews. However, when it comes to horrible customer service, you're more than welcome to count on it from the greeter named Collie. I may have misunderstood his name, but I was clear about his actions and mannerisms when I spoke with the manager Memo.

We approached the entrance and no one was in-line and he didn't even look up to say hello. When he did look up, he gave us a disgusting look! There were only two of us and the place was not full. The first table he brought us to, he threw the menus on the table and we asked if he would mind moving us to a more quiet area towards the back. He then rolled his eyes and didn't move. So, I took charge and requested to sit at a one of the open tables in the back. Once we arrived, he threw the menus on the table and walked away. I asked him nicely with his back turned was his manager available. He ignored me until I touched his shoulder. I let him know he was providing the worst customer service I had ever experienced, almost borderline racism as we're a mixed black and Asian couple.

We brought it to the attention of Memo, who immediately apologized and was accommodating. We made it clear we don't need anything. Our sole intent was to help him understand what took place and he said he would speak to him. 

We still ordered our food and left the customary 20% tip! 

We all have bad days, but this went well beyond the treatment anyone should experience. Love the atmosphere and the food!

Came here a few months ago and ordered an open face sandwich and steak salad. For airport food it's actually good. Today we had ordered the chop salad as well as the tomato cream soup. The soup was very tasty as well as creamy. The salad, which was good however was meant apparently for a child. The salad, which is very pretty don't get me wrong is striped with tomatoes, sweet corn, tasted like corn pops as well as chicken. There is also trail mix thrown into the salad. The avocado ranch tastes homemade, but the portion size is ridiculously small!!

I would suggest giving a little more food to the customer considering your charging higher end restaurant fees for small portions in a airport! The host was really sweet too and had to throw how a drunk customer.
Had the pork chile burger thing as our waiter said it would be the best burger I ever had. Yup, insanely good! Everything we ate was awesome!
First time here, it's restaurant week... 3 corse meal for $33 bomb ass food great price. Lovvvve the decor ESP the chandeliers, verrrry pretty!!!

Great place for a drink. Fast service and they expedite. I didn't have food but will be back for sure next time at B gates in PDX.  They really a lot better than most airport bars in terms of speed and service.

I was visiting the area and many recommended this restaurant and the Chopped Salad. It was 5:00 on a Monday so it wasn't busy but I sat at the bar and ordered the Chopped Salad. It wasn't what I expected but I thought it was fantastic. The bartenders George & Liz were awesome. I would definitely go back.

This place is wonderful!! Finding a yummy and relaxing and welcoming place in an airport is usually a fruitless exercise. But... If you are in the Phoenix airport for a long-ish layover, make your way over to Terminal 4, and the B concourse. Right by gate B22, you will find a place with delightful options, both in food and drink, and also delightful people. The staff is attentive, courteous and engaging, without invading your space. My husband and I are both vegetarians, so options were limited, but the Burrata Insalata salad was unreal (see pic). Buffalo Mozzarella, arugula, grape tomatoes and a huge helping of avocado topped with a few fried shallots--as I said, UN REAL. Price-wise, for a sit-down slice of heaven in an airport, $11 is hard to beat for a delicious and filling salad. I also had a glass of wine (zin from chronic cellars) that was delicious and about $8. You will do yourself a favor if you head over there. It helped put a bad previous flight experience and a long layover out of my head. Enjoy!!

I love the attitude of Cowboy Ciao.

COWBOY CIAO: HISTORY 

Cowboy Ciao opened in February, 1997, and it was well into 1998 before information operators stopped telling callers that they didn't exist because they tried "Cowboy Chow" instead of the proper name "Cowboy Ciao." That irreverence, stubbornness and self-confidence that the stupidity lies in the other person, so let them figure it out if it's important enough, is right in my wheelhouse. It doesn't hurt that Cowboy Ciao also sits on a prime piece of Old Town real estate on Stetson Drive and has some of the best and most creative food currently available.

Cowboy Ciao began as a neighborhood joint with the wine-friendly fare focused on Italy, Mexico and the American Southwest and has since evolved into a "Big City" restaurant featuring a Modern American menu with Southwest accents and Global influences, sporting an internationally-acclaimed wine list hovering around 2000 selections.

THE STORY 

I've been several times and nothing about Cowboy Ciao ever gets old: Elegant chandeliers, rustic seating and an edgy bar with a great view of Old Town Scottsdale from almost everywhere.

The food is like none other and the drink selection is outstanding.

Some of the food choices I've enjoyed are the sticky short ribs, grilled salmon, hominy, the world famous exotic mushroom pan fry and the chocolate budino and bacon beignet. (see pics)

Some of my favorite drinks include the Argentine Malbec and Laurent Perriet Ros. (see pics)

SERVICE EXPERIENCE 

The staff is hit or miss; usually hit, although I have had one less than stellar server, but nothing worth more than excusing the experience as a fluke. Usually, the staff is very attentive, but not intrusive and helpful with wine selections.

CONCLUSION 

5/5 RECOMMEND 

OF NOTE

*Awards & Accolades

In the almost 20 years since opening, Cowboy Ciao has received numerous awards and accolades, including "Best Example of Food as Sex" from Phoenix Magazine, honoring the Exotic Mushroom Pan Fry (which I had - see pic), "Best Dessert Menu in Town (if not the Galaxy!)" from the Phoenix New Times, "Best Place to Eat, Drink, & Be Merry" from the Arizona Republic, "National After The Last Roundup" from Esquire Magazine, "Hot Spot For The Hip With Seriously Good Food; A Spaghetti Western With A Happy Ending" from Zagat Guide, "Cowboy Ciao in Scottsdale Is A First Rate Restaurant and Wine Destination" from the London Times, "Cowboy Ciao Is A Don't Miss Dining Adventure" from Der Spiegel and many more.

*Events & Private Parties

Cowboy Ciao is available for special occasions and can host parties from 10-200 guests with a sample group menu or a customized proposal.

*Specials

This Valentine's Day Special includes a three course, price fixe $68 per person ($44 from 5pm-5:45pm).

*Hours:
Lunch: Daily 11:30am - 2:30pm
Dinner: Nightly 5pm - 10pm

*For more information:
cowboyciao.com

During a lengthy layover in Phoenix, we went for a late lunch at Cowboy Ciano.  I had the Stetson chopped salad and Truffle Mac and Cheese.  Both were delicious.  My wife shared my salad and had the scallops over risotto.  Her meal was also delicious.  Very interesting dining experience in of one of the strangest locations: the airport.  Service was very good.

Great, unique restaurant.
The staff was super friendly & helpful. 
Chopped salad was amazing, great wine & cocktail list!

Haven't been here in a long time but recently went mid week and the service was amazing! Great drinks (I had the Viva!) and of course the chop salad is to die for. Four top and everyone licked their plates clean! Great old town establishment and a good option for out of town guests!

Fun, loud atmosphere. Fun for groups or with your honey. The Stetson Chopped Salad is a must. You could share it but why not eat it all? The textures and blend of ingredients are perfection! Everything was delicious. We also tried the mushroom dish which was just as delicious. The mini appetizer size was plenty to share.  I need to try each dish at least once before I die. An absolute must-go place to dine in Scottsdale.

B-concourse ((gates 15-28?), good place to eat or grab a bevvie... And their steak sandwich is awesome! Two small super-tender (med-rare) filet mignons on a ciabatta slab, with onions and a sauce that's a great compliment! Top if off w/a bottle of Pinot Grigio that's reasonably priced, and you've got a winning combo!

As a Londoner living in Scottsdale I got very excited reading all the different dishes on offer! I hadn't seen another menu like it and not everything was smothered in cheese! 
The food was yummy. The Mushroom dish excels in flavour. The scallops were succulent and cooked to perfection...the poem dish was so tender....I can not wait to return and try the peanut butter thingy!!!!!!!!! 
Good service ...good food...winning combination!

I had a four hour lay-over in terminal 4 and wasn't quite sure how I was going to kill the time.  Saddled up at Cowboy Ciao for wine and lunch, and have to say, the Stetson salad was one of the best salads I have ever had (and I eat so much salad, I am practically a rabbit).  Naturally, the wine was properly chilled and delicious!  This was an absolutely perfect experience, as the service was phenomenal (her name was Elizabeth) and not once did I feel rushed or like they didn't want me lurking for too long.  I travel through this airport very often, and this will be a regular stop!

I've eaten here twice, once at their main location and once at their airport location and I've been disappointed both times. The food is good but not great and the prices are high. In my opinion, not worth it.

Considering how well reviewed this restaurant is, you would think they would know how to properly cook a flour tortilla, and not turn eggs into unseasoned hunks of rubber. The staff were very polite and very attentive, but the sad attempt at "Breakfast Enchiladas" I received  for 15 bucks left me with a bad taste in my mouth, both figuratively and literally. Hoping my experience was just a fluke.
This place gets two stars because its slightly better than Matt's Big Breakfast in the airport, but still awful.

I can see why a person might like cowboy ciao, but I did not. Its definitely "out of the box" all the way. They have this moronically gigantic winelist that goes in order of price only--so if u want say, a Pinot, u have to look all throughout this ridiculously huge and not great list. Then they are out of the wine, and u have to wait for the "master wine f**face" to give u a recommendation. Very painful!! The service was atrocious--grossly disorganized, slow, unbelievable. The food was ok, somewhat overwrought, but definitely not worth the wait. While I liked a couple of the dishes, I'd definitely head to any of the other fine choices in the area and save yourself from the disorganized and inefficient service here.

Wait staff (T.J.) was awesome;  energetic,  a lot of pride in the brand and presentation and menu-smart.  I had the open-face steak sandwich. It's a 5-6oz filet mignon that was perfectly medium rare and very tender. I personally would have preferred fries over chips,  but didnt know that so didn't try to substitute anything. My daughter had the quesadilla of the day and said it was really good but that the chipotle mayo dressing was outstanding. Considering what you usually get at Phoenix's airport for food, this was a real treat.

After a long day in airports -- and a pretty bad meal at a place in Mexico -- it was refreshing to have a decent meal here at AZ's airport! We were really close to choosing McD's when an airport working suggested we try Cowboy Caio, and I'm so glad we did. 
We had the open-faced steak sandwich, which was well flavored and cooked just the way I like it (med rare) atop a nicely grilled and buttered piece of bread. It came with kettle chips drizzled in bleu cheese, but because I wasn't a huge fan of the cheese, the waiter suggested I dip them in this pesto aioli that was yum!
We also had a shared plate under the heading "Grazing" that turned out to be a huge dish. It was a green chile pappardelle concoction that sounded kinda weird at first but was surprisingly delicious. It kind of reminded me of tuna casserole... but in a good way if you can image that.
The wine, beer and Bloody Mary list was pretty impressive, though they seemed to be running low on the white wine selections when we came in.
All in all, I really enjoyed it and was happy to find it in the mess that can be airport food.

Was not impressed.  A few friends have said citizen public house is better all around, but we took our chances.  Service was good, food was average.  When your in Scottsdale and going to a great food place (especially at $75 a person) I guess I just simply expected a bit more.  Chop salad is great, warm bread was good, pork chop was a little dry, but the surprise was the bill.  $150 for 2, with only 2 drinks.  No dessert either.  Average, and prob wont be back.
Absolutely delicious! I got the burger no bun and it was amazing!!! I am so happy I stopped here on my way to my next flight!

Awesome new spot in PHX;, which they have needed for a long long long time. 

I got the testosterone salad. Amazing. Blu cheese crumbles, rare steak, good greens. Beats normal airport food any damn day.

Walking thru ol'town I stumbled upon this place. Rustic, laid back and yes-- great eats. 

The Stetson salad.....absolutely fantastic. 

The mushroom entree was really great. 7 types of mushrooms. 

I couldn't figure out the wine list, but who cares once you try the Stetson salad your all set.

If I return to Scottsdale, this place is on my list!

There are two places that reside at the top of my list as must-go recommendations in the Phoenix area, and it's Cowboy Ciao and Pizzeria Bianco, but not necessarily in that order.  I'd give the Ciao 4 1/2 stars if I could, but since that's not an option and I love this place, it's getting the full 5 from me.

Why?

Well, to start, the magic words are "Exotic Mushroom Pan Fry".  On the menu, it's stated a guest described it as being so good, they wanted to take their clothes off and roll in it.  Personally, I feel that would be rushing things.  This is a dish you need to take out to its own dinner first.  Share a bottle of wine with it.  Ask it about its dreams and its favorite books and shows.  Meet its parents, ask them permission to take things to the next level, and when the time is right, then you can get naked and commence aforementioned slather rolling.

Of course this only goes for mushroom lovers.  For those anti-mushroom-ites out there, I don't understand you, but turn your heads for a sec and hum the theme to Mario Bros while I whisper the ingredients to those with an affinity for Earth's favorite fungal treat:

(Cremini, button, oyster, cepe, lobster, black trumpet, shiitake, morel, and yellow foot mushrooms in ancho cream over double-cooked polenta, topped with grilled portabellini, avocado, tomato and cotija cheese)

I know, right?  And yes it tastes as good as it sounds.  

For the mushroom challenged, you can look back now.  Another dish I highly recommend is their "Stuffed Pork Rib Chop" which is gorged with Shropshire blue cheese then grill-seared and oven-finished and served with ancho bread pudding, apple jus, raisin/fig compote and pan-grilled vegetables.  Holy hell this is good.  This is the kind of dish you cheat on the Mushroom dish with, let's call it your Meat Mistress.  This dish says to hell with rolling around naked, and suggests going straight to a threesome.  Any of the dishes on the menu will fit the bill for this taste romp, as would the many creative drinks they have to offer.  Just do what it says and remember to set your safe word.

For dessert, skip the bacon cookies.  It's interesting and all, but really not worth it.  Instead go with the blue cheese cheesecake or the bread pudding.

I've been here half a dozen times and loved it each time.  There are still many more dishes I'd love to try, including the hearty salads I never got around to.  I just hope their Testosterone Salad is named for being manly in its steak and bourbon soaked roots, and not due to containing millions of little swimming chromosomes.  Forget I said that... 

Oh hey try not to get lost in the wine list!  It's a labyrinth best left to the Goblin King.  But even 1986 David Bowie might not find his way out of this one.  Don't say I didn't warn you.  Just go with one of the dozen or so wine flights available unless you know exactly what you want.  The wine list has no real power over you as long as you don't show visible fear.  It can smell fear.

Super service and great food. VERY unexpected for an airport restaurant. 

I accidentally left my wallet and one of the starters was running all over the airport trying to find me. Who does things like that anymore!?

Cowboy Ciao is great. The drinks are great, the food is delicious! We loved the scallops and chopped salad! Blueberry donuts for dessert!? What? Yes please. Tito the bartender was awesome, sit at the bar it's quieter and more pleasant hanging out with Tito! The one draw back and reason for a 4 star rating issss the hostess Olivia.She has an attitude. She tried to seat us at a two top in the sun surrounded by noisy tables. I asked to sit elsewhere and she looked at me like I was from another planet. She said they wouldn't have another server for 20 min. Didn't ask if we wanted to wait. We opted to sit at the bar and watched her seat other couples in the quieter room. She never checked back to see if we wanted to move. I give her a thumbs down but the restaurant a big thumbs up!

Delicious place, so glad I got to come here!  Everything was flavored fantastically, I was really impressed.

Their Chopped Salad was really good (as everyone says) with bits of salmon, corn, lettuce, tomatoes...it was crunchy, chewy, soft all at the same time.  Their Chicken Fried Trout was really good, somehow, it tasted completely non-fishy and was fried perfectly.  Their Exotic Mushroom Pan Fry was really good, with different types of mushroom in sauce over polenta.  Their Nuts About Scallops was really good too, crispy fried scallops served with a really good risotto.  Every dish we had was a perfect complement to the other (we shared everything!).

I would get every dish we had here again, twice, three times.  I want to go back!

What a great and interesting meal!

In town for business and looking at CC's menu, I was intrigued when I saw Wild Boar  Meatballs.   Starting with drinks, they have an amazing mixologist behind the bar.  I went for a drink called Viva based on the waitress' recommendation.    This was a very refreshing, strawberry based drink with different herbs and fresh ingredients.  They also have an incredible wine list ranging from an inexpensive bottle up to $1500 + bottle of vintage.

We decided on the small plates menu as it was late and also there were a great deal of interesting items in this area.  The thing that impresses me so about this restaurant is the interesting combinations the Chef brings together.

To start. the Stetson Chopped Salad is an absolute must!  The waitress brings out this perfectly arranged aligned plate of chopped lettuce, chopped smoked salmon, trail mix, cous cous, and corn.  She mixed this all up with their amazing dressing and served the two portions.  It was an amazing explosion of different tastes and textures ranging from smoky salmon to sweet little raisins from the trail mix.  I could eat this every day!

For small plates; we went with the Burrata with Avocado and olive oil which was  a very tasty combination and a great start.  From there we went with the Wild Boar meatball which was although this was what brought me here, it was my least favorite dish.   Next we had the most amazing and interesting dish of the night, Pork Belly served on a toasted pumpkin bread.  This was absolutely amazing!  The salty and fatty pork belly was so perfectly matched with the sweet crunchy pumpkin bread.  I cant stress enough how amazing this was!  Our last plate was the Tiger Shrimp with corn and bacon.  The shrimp was perfectly grilled, the corn mixed with bacon was a great addition to the dish.

We were to full for dessert however all looked amazing including a dish that had ice cream made with duck fat. Cmon, really!

A must next time I'm in Scottsdale again or maybe this is the reason to come to Scottsdale.

I have been to this airport restaurant a few times now. I like it. Here's why:

They have seating. Yes, it's a sit down spot where you can catch your breath and relax. I'm usually coming off a long business trip and it's nice to take a minute before jumping on a plane.

Booze. They have a bar with your basics to help you unwind a bit before departure. 

They veganize! It really shouldn't be so difficult to find vegan options these days but many airports just haven't caught up. All the pre-packaged stuff has meat, cheese or both. This place has always been able to veganize for me. 

Service. Always friendly, fast and make the experience feel like you're not sitting in an airport. 

If any of those options interest you, and you're in Terminal 4 at B gates, go.

The worst service I have experienced since moving to AZ two years ago ! Overpriced and food was  ordinary. The waiter served me a desert from their fixed price menu instead of but like the one I ordered and it 
Bread pudding was harder than a rock. Speaking of rocks the cement wall and padless hard wood chairs did nothing for my comfort or the ambiance.

Have the chopped salad, which they toss at your table. Perfect blend of flavors and textures. Then opt for the ELK. Medium rare and prepared perfectly, was juicy and flavorful.Shared the bread pudding which is unique with layered slices versus chunks of bread. After three days of dining our guests talked about their meal here more than anywhere else. Just go!

Live in SanFran area, and visit this place every time in Scottsdale.
This place is overpriced, poor menu design and flat out unimpressive.  Considering the price tag, I expected a lot more.  This place underdelivered like Alex Rodriguez in the playoffs.

Perfect dining experience. Started off with their cherry cocktail and it was so good I had two!  My friend and I shared the dungeness crab enchilada for an appetizer.  We had to sit for a moment to enjoy the aroma before digging in and we knew it was going to be amazing..as it was. The guacalmole salsa is the best I have ever had. I didn't want that course to end. I admit I made sure no one was looking and sopped up the sauce with my finger.:)

I had the "Testosterone Salad". The tenderloin melted in my mouth and the fresh greens were perfectly covered in dressing. Every bite a delight.

My friend got the "Exotic Mushroom Pan Fry" and had a similar experience. Every bite a different flavor. Both of our dishes were great examples of this incredible menu that I have to sample one of everything from!

Since it was her birthday we ordered the "birthday cake" for dessert and it was simply the best cake I have ever eaten. The chocolate cake was light and the marscapone frosting made to perfection.  I don't care for super sweet desserts and this was just right. Take note other bakers..too much sugar spoils the dessert!

Pefect service and wonderful atmosphere will have me bringing friends and guests back !

Another AZ restaurant week stop. It was a busy Saturday night when we ate so I think wait time for our food was a little longer than usual. We did the special three course menu, but added the mushroom dish and the stetson salad courses. We also got a side of truffled Mac n cheese. I know, I know we are fatties. Of the starters we tried the meatballs and deconstructed sushi roll. The meatballs were AHmazing. Sushi roll idea was cool and tasted good, but paled in comparison to the meatball dish. Mac n cheese was creamy an decadent, truffle flavor was not overpowering. Mushrooms were good, but kind of forgettable, would not get again. Stetson salad is a winner, I could have just eaten a full sized version as my entree. Speaking of entrees, we got the flat iron steak and red snapper. The steak was cooked to perfect medium rare. The snapper was a little dry. We weren't blown away by either entree to be honest. Thankfully we ended on a very happy note with dessert, the flourless brownie and lemon poppy bread pudding. I could have eaten double portions of both despite being absolutely stuffed.
Airport business is hard. They stepped it down for this extension to the scottsdale classic. Food is weak and overpriced for what they provide here. Try harder. Might be confused with chilies.

The fact that I'm even allowed to eat out in Arizona is...well, lucky. If it were up to my Jewish grandmother, we'd clean out her freezer. She'd be happy, but we certainly wouldn't! But since she admitted her alcohol stock is not up to par compared with the amount of food she has stored away, my boyfriend and I were permitted to seek out a quiet spot to enjoy some late evening drinks.

When we stumbled upon Cowboy Ciao in the Old Town Scottsdale area, I was thrilled, because in contrast to the other nightspots around, Cowboy Ciao seemed promisingly chill, and it is! Bistro-y with a soft Southwestern vibe, I would have LOVED to eat here for dinner--so many delicious choices: the cabernet rubbed filet mignon, Hawaiian Ahi tuna, lamb shank, pork belly, their famous bread pudding...the list goes on. 

Alas, we sat at the bar and were astonished to find Cowboy Ciao has been acknowledged to have one of the most diversified wine lists...anywhere. Fabulous. To accompany that, many wines by the glass are offered and affordable. To TOP that, they offer wine flights! Oh, the delight! I ordered up the Pink Bubbles flight (teehee!) with three glasses of international ros. Each had distinct difference, all were refreshing, and the flight came with a personal print-up of what I was going to imbibe. Did I take it with me? No, of course not, I was too drunk on ros to remember! =)

While our bar experience was lovely, the next time I am in town, I'm going to convince ol' granny to bring us back to Cowboy Ciao...and chow down on some exquisite sounding plates.

This is probably the best airport bar I've been to. I had an hr to kill and decided to stop here before my flight back to LA.

I walked on over and they initially had an issue with accepting cards and were cash only, but that was fixed by the time I left 2 drinks later. 

There was open bar seating and I usually hate sitting at the bar by mself, but its the airport so eveyone is pretty much by themselves. Plus, i used the convienant outlets right underneath the countertop to charge my phone. 

The bartender was great. I can't remember his name but he was helpful with recommendations and very entertaining as he sang to the overhead music. 

I ended up getting a beer to start and then had a glass of Zinfandel to finish. The lady sitting next to me had it and recommended it, which was great. I had never actually had a glass of Zinfadel before then. It was funny because she had commented that no matter what time it is in the airport, people are always drinking. Granted it was 6pm when she said that, but her statment was true nonetheless. 

She also got the quesadilla which apparentlynis a restaurant favorite. I guess I'll have to come back for that. Great experience and I would gladly come back again.

This may be one of the best airport restaurants in the US. Pricey, yes for an airport but I think worth it. The chopped salad was one of the best salads I gave ever had. Very, very unique. I will always come back here when I am at PHX

Went here for my 30th birthday celebration last week - I've been wanting to try this place for so long! We got a great little table by the window and I loved the dim lighting and ambiance. It was definitely a great date place, although a bit loud. 
We started with the mac and cheese - YUM! Cheese, truffle, and porcetta - can't go wrong there. It was the perfect size to split for an appetizer. I ordered the Stetson Chopped Salad after hearing about it so many times. I hate to say that I was very underwhelmed. The lettuce was wilty and white, the corn was not fresh, but dry (reminded me of the corn in the  Cup of Soups), and...no avocado? Say whhhatt?
He got the filet mignon and oh man it hit the jack pot. I may or may not have eaten a few large bites of that. It was melt-in-your-mouth yummy and the mashed potatoes it sat on were creamy and delicious.
Their wine list is extensive and amazing. I hear their craft cocktails are great, too. 
We finished off with a slice of their birthday cake with a candle. It was REALLY good. I believe it was chocolate cake with cheesecake frosting. Such a great way to end the meal. 
I will be back for sure, but will get something other than the chopped salad! (Sorry, but Citizen Public House's is better).

Thought I'd get the salmon salad here because I'm gluten free and choices in the airport are limited.   The cashier was helpful in getting the fried corn which was breaded off the salad,  but then there was all this pasta  in the salad that looked like rice that was unlisted in the menu.   Also that salad was very pricey at $20 (even for airport) . So in the end the menu was inaccurate I got glutenated and the food was expensive.
If you really love mushrooms get the mushroom dish it comes in a smaller version and is perfect with the asiago bread!

Terrific experience on 2/13/14 at the bar, entertained and taken care of by Sean (Shawn) whose detailed information helped us finally decide on a fabulous dessert.  The atmosphere is charming and fun.  We didn't make it for dinner, but what we saw coming out of the "Home on the Range" kitchen looked fabulous!

Ask for TJ, great service, enthusiastic, total professional and you can tell he loves what he does.

Try the Mac N Cheese (best mac and cheese I've ever had)

Also try the Stetson chopped salad with Salmon, even if you're not a salad person, you will absolutely love it.
One of my favorites by far. I crave the Stetson chopped salad and open face steak sandwich. Food and service are impeccable. If I'm ever in the area I stop in.

Amazing place to eat.
My favorite hands down is their chopped salad but warning you now...it's addicting! I'm not kidding!
You can have it vegetarian or pick your protein, either way, it's different and incredible!

Loved.  For upscale Scottsdale, this was a very reasonable place to have a nice dinner.  The Halibut was the BOMB!  The curry was not spicy at all, which I liked.  Service was a bit slow - but we were in no hurry and it was a Saturday night.  We are definately going back here when in Scottsdale.
Haven't even tried the food. Yelp says they are open till 10 but apparently kitchen closes at 8

Unbelievable food! Plays on every taste bud! Great ambience, wonderful waiter. Had a memorable culinary experience! Please listen to everyone and get the Stetson salad, the duck is wow! Smoky flavor delicioso! Overall best restaurant for us in Scottsdale.

Cowboy Ciao is overall well rounded. Great interior design, fantastic service, and well cooked filet. It is also a good place to go just for dessert. The white chocolate blondie and  bread pudding are my favs.

This restaurant is as good as most of the reviews say it is.  First, the service was impeccable and the atmosphere was great.  From the outside, it looks like it would be ultra pretentious due to the dim lighting, but I was pleasantly surprised to find it was much more laid back.

We sat at the bar because the restaurant was so busy, where Maryanne was our bartender and server.  She did an amazing job despite having to tend to the needs of about 15 other people sitting at the bar.

The food we ate was absolutely incredible.  I can't recommend the "Stetson Chopped Salad" enough -- the menu doesn't tell you anything about it other than how good it is.  Trust me, it's mind blowingly good and you should order it.

The New Zealand peppercorn Lamb was fantastic as well. Cooked perfectly and well seasoned. 

When I'm back in Scottsdale, I'm making it a point to come here again..

Horrible customer service! One of the servers "TJ" damn near ripped a plate out of my friend's hands and told her that he'd just take the food if she wasn't going to eat the dish right! Like seriously dude?! Y'all need some serious customer service training! I gave it one star because zero stars wasn't an option.

We had dinner @ their restaurant in Scottsdale last night, and this place may be better!  We are @ the bar and the service was awesome! 

Hayley had the chop salad (they offer chicken here too, instead of salmon) and I had the testosterone salad...really good.
They clean the tables and bar and rinse the rag with the same water they rinse the "clean" glass ware with.  Nasty!!!!
Cowboy Ciao was so good! We had a bunch of the appetizers and the salad was the best on the menu. It's right in the heart of Scottsdale so perfect for a date night or a night out with friends.

Running through the airport to my flight and thought I would sit down for a quick bite to eat.  The breakfast menu was small with only 5 items but they all looked good so I thought I would give it a go.

My waitress sat me fast and obviously had too much coffee this morning but no big deal, she was nice.
I opted for the Monday Quesadilla, apparently they decide what's inside every Monday.  Mine was filled with Oaxaca and Jack cheese, short rib and egg topped with chipotle sour cream drizzle and fresh Pico de gallo.  YUM!  I scarfed it up so fast my waitress thought I dropped the plate.

Airport food at Phoenix Sky Harbor has definitely been changing for the better and this was just another example of how a local restaurant can serve the same great food in an airport location.

Next time I'll try the Chocolate Chip Pancakes!

This place is a joke! They boast a wine list of 2000 wines, but try to order one. We have been coming here for 14 years and have never been able to get our first choice of wine. On this visit, our first choice was a bottle that was also available by the glass. Our server said she couldn't sell us a bottle, because they didn't have enough, and had to save it for single glass servings. What? Why is it on the bottle menu then? Also if you are selling this by the glass I would assume that you have many bottles in stock. So we continued our selection process. And on the 5th try we finally got a bottle. Every time we chose a bottle, the server had to go look for it, while we had to wait for her to come back, only to tell us it was out of stock. Each time she suggested another wine at a much higher price. Had she offered us her selection at the price of our preferred choice, we would have taken it. The entire wine selection process from our initial request to actually getting the bottle took 40 minutes. Absolutely ridiculous! They don't know what they have in stock, and can't find what they do have in a timely manner. I asked our server if they use a computer to track the inventory and locations and she said the owner doesn't do that because it is too difficult. The owner here is obviously clueless. They filed for Chapter 11 earlier this year, and that does not surprise me. The quality of the food has suffered too. They are probably trying to save money to pay the creditors. My prediction is that they will close down soon. What was once one of our favorites is now a place we will never return too. Stay away, you will only be disappointed

Very similar to the Citizen's down the street.  The food was decent, but there was nothing special about the drinks.  I would have rated them 3.5-4 stars, but the amount of bloody, dried, human fluid on bathroom wall will keep me from coming back.  The women's bathroom had 1 stall working out of 3.

I expect more when I pay $175 for dinner for 2.

This restaurant is a must when you're visiting the area. It's got a great vibe and ambience, the wine list is out of control, food amazing and the service is just above and beyond. We had the tiger prawns, Filet Mignon and sword fish...soo good. Take your time and enjoy yourself when you get the chance to visit cowboy ciao :)
Came again and had the chopped salad.  It was amazing.  They have the best service of any airport.  The food is always great.

The prawn/shrimp appetizer was delicious.  The chopped salad was also pretty amazing.  Not as great as the citizen public house, but pretty good for airport food.  I was going to give it a 4 but I gave CPB that rating.  Service was excellent. You could do worse with PHX offerings.

Ate here once, and its just OK
If it was not in an airport, I would not go back...  lol
Great food, service and drinks! Buffalo carpaccio is a must have! The wine list will take you days to read something from it and then start reading

Our first time for Cowboy Chiao. The chopped salad with avocado was delicious. My new favorite chopped salad. Large portions, come hungry. Short rib with Dijon Yukon mash and Brussels was tasty and different. We are so full, that we are taking a bread pudding home to share later.

Their chopped salad is amazing! I ate one there and then got another to go. The staff was friendly too. It's pretty dark and loud in there esp for a Sunday but I think that's what they are going for. Will be back just for the salad!
Heard about this place since I moved to the area. The Stetson salad is how good as they say it is. I've been back few times more. Always end up with the same thing. It's delicious.

The consummate out-of-towner restaurant in Scottsdale. They play up the whole cowboy thing and blend it to create Southwestern Italian. (Which, by the way, I vote to officially change to "spaghetti western"). 

The food is creative and the ambiance is fun and pleasant, but I was not completely blown away by the tastebuds, which I like my five star restaurants to do. 

Still, a can't miss for anyone who is visiting Old Town Scottsdale.

Ordered 4 breakfast meals. The biscuits and gravy were average. The chicken quesadilla wasn't good - avoid it. 

The only winner was the chocolate chip pancakes. Good flavor and well worth it. 

Our first time here will also be our last time here.

A wise friend once told me that any type of "cheek" on the menu must be delicious so order it...beef cheek, fish cheek, and of course, pork cheek.  On Cowboy Ciao, it's an appetizer called Cheeky Porky, and the pork cheek is served with corn cakes with aioli and micro greens.  The only miss was the air dried corn that was chewy like uncooked corn.  Decent sized cheek(s), so much so that i ordered this appetizer as a meal.  They also had Fever Tree ginger beer on the menu, which I love.   

The "Cowboy" part of Cowboy Ciao is evident in the decor and ambiance...wood everywhere, cheap-ish chandelier draped with beads.  Very friendly staff...there's an open window at the bar where watching the chefs prepare food kept me entertained.

Shiny

I've been to chow here a number times and the food is relatively consistent.  For the money, go for the pork shank, lamb or short ribs.  Those are my go-to dishes when dining here.  Unfortunately, they're also a little hit or miss.  On my last visit, the short ribs were dry and not as fork tender as it should be.  At $30+ for the entrees, I would expect a lot better execution.  

To wash it down, you can check out their extensive wine list.  I love the organization of it: by varietal and, subsequently, ascending by price.  I can't count the number of times I've had to hunt through a binder for bargains.  Here, I can just figure out my price range and hunt each varietal until I find something. 

I've never ordered any of the appetizers, though they all look good.  But no, I save myself for the deserts.  Well, the bread pudding to be specific.  This is probably a top 5 bread pudding for me.  So rich and tasty I could make a meal out of it.  

Now, other than eating a meal or desert, you could come here just for the popcorn.  Orville Redenbacher got nuthin on this stuff.  Caramel, bacon and chocolate.  This is the kind of stuff I LIVE for.  If you're visiting from out of town, pay the $7 and buy a bag to eat on the plane (and watch your neighbors drool).

They also used to make a P-H-E-N-O-M-E-N-A-L bacon peanut brittle.  The bacon peanut brittle is, quite simply, a necessary addition to anyone's diet.  I've had the walnut bacon brittle, and while tasty in and of itself, is simply not as good as the peanut version.  My last two visits they didn't have any, but I intend to bang on their door every time I'm in Scottsdale just to check.  They're lucky I don't live in Scottsdale anymore or else they'd make some just to get rid of me.  

Sure, you can come here for the food (to which I would have given 3 stars) and wine, but the bread pudding and brittle make this place shine.

This place does not need another review, but I'll chime in anyway.

I have been dreaming of coming her for several months after countless hours of drooling over their website.

I went for a late lunch with the Gorgeous Gabi.  
We had the restaurant all to ourselves, it was quiet and comfortable.

I ended up just ordering a salad, it was so hot out (surprise) and I just wanted something light. 
I got a Diet Coke and the Caesar Romero Salad (see pics) it consisted of; mixed greens with cilantro dressing, grilled lemon/herb chicken, fontina, cherry tomatoes and toasted pepitas. 

It was really good, I like the mixed greens in place of the usual romaine and although I didn't taste much cilantro it had great flavor.

Our waitress was not very attentive at all, when she did come around to grab my empty glass of soda she did not ask me if I'd like another, instead she brought me a glass of water.........with a bug in it! 

I'm giving 3 stars for now, but I will go back because there are still quite a few things on the menu I'd like to try.

Pro tip: Hike Camel Back mountain before and work up an appetite if you want to feel all the feels. 

Stetson chopped is Beethoven's 9th in food form. 
Pork Barbacoa tastes like home. And, I'm from Australia, which doesn't even make sense. It's so good you won't remember major facts about your own personality.

Cocktails are legitimately incredible, too. Their semi-secret concoction called the 'One (upon a) Time' truly tastes like stuff, although I still cannot figure out what. How the cocktail menu puts it: "Barely legal pisco/coca leaf thing". Whatever it is, it's totally delicious. Moving on, the Duchovny & Punching is a cocktail in a class of its own. It's some sort of confusing clarified buttermilk thing with a bunch of other things in it which ultimately manifests into something so refined and pure it's what I would fill all the water fountains of heaven with if I were god. 

+ excellent and friendly service. So yeah, 5 white hot stars.

We decided to dine here for our anniversary and we couldn't have been more pleased! For drinks we ordered a Manhattan and a brandy old fashion (both were good!). For an appetizer we ordered the buffalo carpaccio and it was delicious. This place is definitely quality over quantity and we finished the plate wanting three more orders, ha. For our main course I had the jerk seared ahi-tuna and it was to die for. The sweet potatoes and the tuna were my favorite thing on the plate. My husband ordered the grilled swordfish and it melted in his mouth. SO GOOD. We got the bread pudding for dessert and it was the best thing we could have ordered to finish off the night. 

HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

So, I had to head out to Nevada for work - and as I am wont to do, I scheduled my layovers (length AND location) based on meal times.  Lunch in Charlotte, NC and dinner in Phoenix.  Wandered the airport, and with the aid of Gate Guru and Yelp - found this place.

And boy, am I glad I did.  I was seated quickly, ordered my beer and started perusing the menu.  As I read the menu - I noticed that they were carrying primal cuts of meat, and fresh vegetables and proteins into the kitchen.  That's a good sign for any restaurant, much less one in an airport.  

I was debating between a couple menu items, and when the waiter came by - I asked which he would order.  He said if I don't find myself in Phoenix very often (which I don't), I should definitely try the Lester.  So, as I have found out in the past - trust a server's recommendation.  Wow.  Just wow.  I don't think I have a vocabulary large enough to describe the flavor explosion that happened in my mouth.  It was AMAZING.

A perfectly cooked burger, topped with bacon, green chili pulled pork, and avocado.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it, and I'm writing this review three months later!  Service was very good, and - it's definitely a good place to grab a bite on your way to your connection.  I was in and out within 40 minutes (I had a 1 1/2 hour lay over) - and I assume had I not ordered the large beer, and taking it to go - I would have definitely made my flight with plenty of time to spare.

The only downside?  It's in an airport, so the atmosphere (I was seated right next to the hustle/bustle of people trying to make their connections) leaves a little to be desired in certain parts of the restaurant.  But, on the other hand - I've never thought higher than 3 stars for any food in a restaurant in an airport before.  So, the next time I find myself at Phoenix Sky Harbor - I know where I'm headed for dinner!

Most amazing salad ever. They also have some outlets, and my server was very nice. The margarita was so-so. Still, this place made my flight delay more bearable and I'm going to be craving the chopped salad for awhile.

I am in love.  This restaurant does everything a good restaurant should.  Ambiance, service and product were good.  The only disappointment I had was with the hour wait on the Monday we went without a reservation.

My party of four had an excellent time celebrating a birthday.  Two had the short ribs.  Tender to a fault, served with delicious Bar-B-Que sauce and pecan grits.  One had the fillet with a spicy aioli and delicious potatoes.
My meal was a huge pork chop, stuffed with Maytag bleu on a ancho bread pudding.  

For an app I split the chop salad.  It deserves special mention and I do recommend it, but it is not a sustaining salad, more of a amuse-bouche.  For dessert we split the peanut-butter cheese cake, delicious.

The beverages deserve some mention.  The wine list is this restaurants' only fault, it is tooooo long.  There is a smaller, delicious by-the-glass selection.  The beer selection is well crafted.  I had two of my favorite beers, Dogfishhead Chicory Stout, something I had only had by bottle, wonderful.

I normally don't like high-priced eateries b/c there is often a lack of creativity, Cowboy Ciao doesn't disappoint.  Recommended over any Capital Griller or Flemmingsery for creativity and value for dollar.

I loved the look of this place and really wanted to love the food here... I'm a huge truffle mac & cheese fan.. but that's probably my problem because I'm from NY and well Ny always does everything right in my eyes lol. plus I've had the best truffle & mac in the city :) but yeah this truffle mac & cheese didn't do it for me at all. 

I did love the coke served in coke bottles though and the look of the place! it's in a great area and if I got something else on the menu I'd probably be happier. my husband loved his meal so that's good.

We came to Cowboy Ciao for southwestern fare on Mother's Day, and the experience was pleasant and memorable. During our visit, the circular interior was colorful, inviting, and festive. There were several large families and groups on hand, followed by those seated by the large windows looking onto the streets of Old Town Scottsdale. Despite the constant foot traffic and high noise level, the atmosphere was casually laid back and unassuming. 

The Stetson Chopped Salad ($13) came with Atlantic smoked salmon, couscous, chopped arugula, dried corn, pumpkin seeds, black currants, asiago cheese, balsamic, and tomatoes. The salad was neatly arranged in rows, and tossed with just the right amount of creamy buttermilk dressing. The salad was colorful and vibrant. The sweet corn, arugula, currants, and pumpkin seeds added a range of textures and tastes, and the flavors of the cheese, sweet tomatoes, and smoked salmon then gave depth to round out the edges. It was delicious.

The Tiger Prawns ($14) was our favorite dish of the meal. It came with grilled prawns arranged in a mix of green chile corn, hominy, cotija cheese, aioli, lime, and cilantro. To sum it up, it was layers of textures, sweet ingredients, complicated by a hint of lime and chile with bursts of wow factor. I recommend it.

The Mushroom Pan Fry ($15) arrived with 9 different types of mushrooms, ancho cream, double cooked polenta, cojita cheese, avocado, tomatoes, and grilled portabellini. The mushroom stir-fry gave an earthy tone to the dish, with cheese, avocado, and tomatoes to add contrast to lighten the flavors. I wished the texture of the mushrooms were varied to showcase its rich heterogeneity. The cheese could also do a better job at connecting the mushrooms to the firm blocks of polenta. Don't get me wrong, the polenta itself was delicious too, but without an intermediary, the double cooked texture was not enough to bridge itself to the onslaught of rich ingredients. 

They had an extensive wine list, so we also enjoyed the Sky Ciao ($14), which was a flight that included 3-ounce pours of pinot grigio, pineapple wine, and syrah. All three selections were enjoyable, but I liked the pineapple wine the best.

To celebrate Mother's Day, the restaurant also gave complimentary Mimosa and Chocolate Brownies as a parting gift. The Mimosa was a nice opener, and wished there were refills as we waited for the food to arrive. The Chocolate Brownies were some of the best I had tasted. Not too sweet, there was a depth of rich dark chocolate flavors with plenty of soft dark chocolate chips embedded. The restaurant should consider giving these out more frequently.

The only downside to our experience was the wait for the food to arrive. It was Mother's Day and the restaurant was not filled to capacity, so there was no reason for them to be short on staff in the kitchen. Since they did not give out bread before meal, the wait became unbearable and frustrating after a good 45 minutes. These were management issues that are easily solvable, so hopefully they will not overlook them. On the other hand, our server Geoffrey was friendly, accommodating, knowledgeable, and attentive. We would be interested in returning to try their Buffalo dishes, as well as their menu for the Arizona Restaurant Week.
Tiger prawns are more like little shrimps. Disappointed. Not impressed by the service. Will not come back

I would choose to eat here even if it wasn't at the airport. The food was actually pretty good! I was really hesitant about ordering my salad because I didn't think it would be filling but on the contrary! It really was so delicious! The dressing was phenomenal... I even started to dip my husband's chips in the dressing!! Go for the Stetson salad!

I really wanted to enjoy this place more after so many raved about it. They especially insisted we try the short rib, as did our server. 

We ordered the bruschetta, short rib and salmon. The salmon was wonderful. The bruschetta were good but there was a ton of red chili flake in the mushroom version which overtook the whole thing. I typically love spice but this was overpowering. The short rib had great flavor but was SO tough and dry. I imagine short rib to be tender and fall apart at the fork. This was difficult to cut into with our butter knife. 

The service was wonderful and our server was friendly and attentive. I'm hoping I can try it again on our next visit as I left disappointed.
Wonderful lunch at Ciao! Wife and I both had Wild Boar Meatballs! Delicious! Service was excellent.

Really great place. 

Popped by here on a early morning layover. 

The guys working the bar area were extremely friendly and offered my wife and I seats immediately. 

I had one of the specials. And the wife had the biscuits and gravy with an egg over easy on top. This was a first for her and for years I have been asking her to get this dish prepared this way. 

She was instAntly in love and started regretting every biscuit and gravy dish she has had before. 

Sometimes you have to just listen to your husband. And/or the bartender/server.

Great experience. Had dinner here last night.  Sat at bar with bartender Mari who was very attentive to all and gave great service. She made awesome drinks too! Stetson salad and pastrami baked short ribs delish. Will go  back again and again!

Everytime I visit my uncle in Apache Junction, we sample at least one of the Phoenix  Metro Area's finest epicurean adventures. On this visit, we selected Cowboy Ciao, based on the outstanding rating and reviews in Yelp. Yelpers, you didn't let us down! This is absolutely THE BEST place we've experienced on all of our sojourns, and we've been to some really good places! There's lots of good stuff to talk about, but the food was so out-of-this-world, let's focus on that. We started with the Mini Mushroom Pan Fry, a smaller version of their "signature dish". The ancho sauce was so incredible that we ordered a ciabatta, not because we really wanted bread, but it would have been criminal to leave even a drop of the sauce behind. Next we had a special appetizer, seared scallops with a shrimp bisque. The scallops were melt-in-your-mouth perfect and the bisque became the next target for the ciabatta, which itself was served with two absolutely delicious olive spreads. We couldn't imagine the dinner getting any better than what was already perfect, but our main courses delivered! We both had the duck breast, a new addition to the menu, replacing the Duck Duck Duck. The duck breast was prepared expertly, rare on the inside, with crisp skin, and bathed in another killer sauce, this time ancho-orange.
